abstracts.cdata!:
This resettlement policy framework
            includes safeguards to address potential economic, social,
            and environmental risks that may arise from involuntary
            resettlement and to mitigate impoverishment risks. The
            category of affected persons are defined as those who stand
            to lose, as a consequence of the program, all or part of
            their physical and non-physical assets, including homes,
            communities, productive lands, resources such as range
            lands, farm lands, or important cultural sites,
            commercial/business properties, tenancy, income-earning
            opportunities, and social and cultural networks and
            activities. An entitlement matrix sets the standards for
            compensation as follows: For loss of arable and grazing
            land, non-arable land, or non-residential land, provide
            either equivalent land or full compensation. Farmers or
            landowners losing arable and grazing land can also opt for
            assistance for land intensification and diversification.
            Full compensation will be paid to the owner, workers, and
            operators or those businesses or commercial and industrial
            activities can be relocated to acceptable sites. Full
            compensation will cover the loss of structures or income
            during the period the affected person could not reap any
            income, or the structure will be relocated to an acceptable
            site. Loss of standing crops and livestock will be fully
            compensated. Compensation paid for loss trees and plants
            will depend on tree type, age, and diameter and/or
            equivalent land will be given for replanting.
